intro: Thesium lisae-mariae, commonly known as the Lisae-Mariae starwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Xanthorrhoeaceae. It is characterized by its compact, low-growing form and produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in clusters. The plant typically thrives in moist, sandy soils and is often found in coastal or dune environments. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, and it is known for its resilience in harsh, saline conditions. Thesium lisae-mariae is primarily found in southern Africa, particularly in Namibia and South Africa.
